title: Define Protocol Requirements for LowLatencyMessagingProtocol
description: Gather and document the requirements for the low-latency messaging protocol, including performance targets (sub-millisecond latency), security considerations (TLS, authentication using JWT, and authorization), compatibility with existing systems such as WebSocket, gRPC, and potentially WebAssembly. An in-depth analysis of trade-offs between latency, reliability, and security is necessary, especially considering high-frequency trading, online gaming, and other real-time applications. Additionally, explore the potential impact on data integrity, consistency, and error handling.

title: Design Protocol Architecture (Revised)
description: This RFC outlines the proposed architecture of the LowLatencyMessagingProtocol. The design includes message formats, transport mechanisms, and error handling strategies tailored for high-frequency trading and online gaming environments. Discussion on latency vs reliability trade-offs, scalability, security, and flexibility considerations are provided. Open issues related to potential architectural choices and their implications are identified, along with proposed solutions. Suggestions for further improvements and potential trade-offs are welcomed.

title: Implement Protocol Core
description: Develop the core functionality of the protocol, including message serialization/deserialization, connection management, and message routing.

title: Implement Protocol Extensions
description: Develop additional features and extensions for the protocol, such as security mechanisms, flow control, and quality of service guarantees.

title: Develop Testing Framework
description: Create a comprehensive testing framework for the protocol, including unit tests, integration tests, and performance benchmarks.

title: Conduct Security Audit
description: Perform a thorough security audit of the protocol implementation, identifying and addressing potential vulnerabilities.

title: Write Documentation
description: Prepare comprehensive documentation for the protocol, including user guides, API references, and deployment instructions.

title: Deploy and Monitor
description: Set up the necessary infrastructure for deploying and monitoring the protocol in production environments.
